p: All microorganisms need iron for their growth and replication (Crumbliss 1990). Several metabolic processes of the erythrocytic malaria parasite are dependent on iron, such as heme synthesis, DNA synthesis, proteolysis of hemoglobin, glycolysis pentose phosphate shunt, mitochondrial electron transport, and CO 2 fixation. It is therefore an indication that capturing iron from the parasite may interfere negatively on its metabolism (Sharma 2005).
